title: [$500] IOS - Chat - Autocorrect replaces the text without user interaction before going to the next page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

comments.body: Job added to Upwork: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~0109790a432df0e00d
Triggered auto assignment to Contributor-plus team member for initial proposal review - @mananjadhav (`External`)
Triggered auto assignment to @JmillsExpensify (`Bug`), see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/14418 for more details.

### Bug0 Triage Checklist ([Main S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418))

- [ ] This "bug" occurs on a supported platform (ensure `Platforms` in OP are ✅)
- [ ] This bug is not a duplicate report (check [E/App issues](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues) and [#expensify-bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM))
    - If it is, comment with a link to the original report, close the issue and add any novel details to the original issue instead
- [ ] This bug is reproducible using the reproduction steps in the OP. [S/O](https://stackoverflowteams.com/c/expensify/questions/14418#:~:text=The%20bug%20is%20reproducible)
    - If the reproduction steps are clear and you're unable to reproduce the bug, check with the reporter and QA first, then close the issue.
    - If the reproduction steps aren't clear and you determine the correct steps, please update the OP.
- [ ] This issue is filled out as thoroughly and clearly as possible
    - Pay special attention to the title, results, platforms where the bug occurs, and if the bug happens on staging/production.
- [ ] I have reviewed and subscribed to the linked Slack conversation to ensure Slack/Github stay in sync

## Proposal

### Please re-state the problem that we are trying to solve in this issue.
When I tap on the "Next" button, I can see that the Title changes to the suggested word without my interaction. On the confirmation window, the title is the one I typed in. When I go back, the title is the suggested word

### What is the root cause of that problem?
It's because of iOS's native behavior, it will select the auto-correct value once the input loses focus.

### What changes do you think we should make in order to solve the problem?
<!-- DO NOT POST CODE DIFFS -->
We should disable `autoCorrect` on the task title input, as well as any other input where we don't want this faulty behavior.

We've done this same thing for many other inputs like [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aa30ef2ea44279637eebb2517b4e08ce88f90e7b/src/pages/workspace/WorkspaceInviteMessagePage.js#L224C21-L224C21) and [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aa30ef2ea44279637eebb2517b4e08ce88f90e7b/src/pages/PrivateNotes/PrivateNotesEditPage.js#L168)

### What alternative solutions did you explore? (Optional)
NA
<!---
ATTN: Contributor+

You are the first line of defense in making sure every proposal has a clear and easily understood problem with a "root cause". Do not approve any proposals that lack a satisfying explanation to the first two prompts. It is CRITICALLY important that we understand the root cause at a minimum even if the solution doesn't directly address it. When we avoid this step we can end up solving the wrong problems entirely or just writing hacks and workarounds.

Instructions for how to review a proposal:

1. Address each contributor proposal one at a time and address each part of the question one at a time e.g. if a solution looks acceptable, but the stated problem is not clear then you should provide feedback and make suggestions to improve each prompt before moving on to the next. Avoid responding to all sections of a proposal at once. Move from one question to the next each time asking the contributor to "Please update your original proposal and tag me again when it's ready for review".

2. Limit excessive conversation and moderate issues to keep them on track. If someone is doing any of the following things please kindly and humbly course-correct them:

- Posting PRs.
- Posting large multi-line diffs (this is basically a PR).
- Skipping any of the required questions.
- Not using the proposal template at all.
- Suggesting that an existing issue is related to the current issue before a problem or root cause has been established.
- Excessively wordy explanations.

3. Choose the first proposal that has a reasonable answer to all the required questions.
-->
@dukenv0307 you are right. Let me know if you are not solving this issue. I can help you to solve this issue

I'm conflicted on this one. 

Autocorrect changing the text when the user navigates to the next screen may be undesired, but the user __*is*__ shown a tooltip of what the text will be changed to along with an "X" to ignore it, so they still have control over what happens next. 

It's also very likely the user may have encountered this kind of behavior before after having autocorrect enabled and should be familiar with its behavior, so the blame wouldn't fall on Expensify for the altered text but rather on the user for not choosing to ignore autocorrect's changes in addition to enabling it in the first place. 

I'm leaning towards doing nothing here, but if a fix is warranted, then that would work too.
Will review this today.

> We've done this same thing for many other inputs like [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aa30ef2ea44279637eebb2517b4e08ce88f90e7b/src/pages/workspace/WorkspaceInviteMessagePage.js#L224C21-L224C21) and [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/aa30ef2ea44279637eebb2517b4e08ce88f90e7b/src/pages/PrivateNotes/PrivateNotesEditPage.js#L168)

FYI We have fixed the same issue in many other places above so we can just do the same here
@JmillsExpensify, @mananjadhav Uh oh! This issue is overdue by 2 days. Don't forget to update your issues!
@JmillsExpensify, @mananjadhav Whoops! This issue is 2 days overdue. Let's get this updated quick!
📣 It's been a week! Do we have any satisfactory proposals yet? Do we need to adjust the bounty for this issue? 💸
Triggered auto assignment to @jasperhuangg, see https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/7972 for more details.
@JmillsExpensify, @mananjadhav, @jasperhuangg Uh oh! This issue is overdue by 2 days. Don't forget to update your issues!

@mananjadhav I don't see this behavior in Android or mWeb since auto-correction in these platforms will only be triggered when the user presses `space` after entering the word.
So maybe we can apply it only for IOS if it is expected
@jasperhuangg Any thoughts on that last comment from @mananjadhav or @dukenv0307?
📣 @mananjadhav Please request via NewDot manual requests for the Reviewer role ($500)

PR still in review

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 1.3.95.0 **Reproducible in staging?: **Y **Reproducible in production?: **Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team **Slack conversation:** ## Action Performed: 1. Open the app 2. Log in 3. Tap on any conversation 4. Tap on the "+" button 5. Tap on the "Assign task" button 6. For the "Title", type in any words that triggers an auto correction / suggestion 7. Tap on the "Next" button 8. Tap on the "Back" button ## Expected Result: Auto correction / suggestion shouldn't change the word without user interaction ## Actual Result: When I tap on the "Next" button, I can see that the Title changes to the suggested word without my interaction. On the confirmation window, the title is the one I typed in. When I go back, the title is the suggested word ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Which of our officially supported platforms is this issue occurring on? - [ ] Android: Native - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: Native - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos Add any screenshot/video evidence https://github.com/Expensify/App/assets/78819774/4024099d-23a4-4746-983c-75b8afecb5a9 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
